message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, laboratory results, and X-ray findings are consistent with rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is a first-line drug for rheumatoid arthritis and inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. Leflunomide is also a first-line drug for rheumatoid arthritis but works by inhibiting pyrimidine synthesis. Hydroxyurea is used to treat sickle cell anemia, and Allopurinol is used to treat gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and laboratory results suggest Rheumatoid Arthritis, for which Methotrexate is the first-line drug. Leflunomide is also used to treat Rheumatoid Arthritis, but inhibits pyrimidine synthesis. Hydroxyurea is used for sickle cell anemia and some cancers, and Allopurinol is used to treat gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and laboratory results of the patient suggest rheumatoid arthritis. The first-line drug for this condition is Methotrexate, which inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. Leflunomide also works for rheumatoid arthritis but it inhibits pyrimidine synthesis. Hydroxyurea is used for cancer and Allopurinol is used for gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, laboratory results, and X-ray findings suggest rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The first-line drug for RA that inhibits dihydrofolate reductase is Methotrexate. Leflunomide is also a first-line drug for RA, but it inhibits pyrimidine synthesis. Hydroxyurea is used for sickle cell disease and some types of cancer. Allopurinol is used to treat gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and laboratory results suggest rheumatoid arthritis, and the first-line treatment for this condition is Methotrexate, which inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. Leflunomide is also a DMARD used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, but it does not inhibit dihydrofolate reductase. Hydroxyurea is used to treat some types of cancer and sickle cell disease, but not rheumatoid arthritis. Allopurinol is used to treat gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presentation and laboratory results suggest rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is a first-line drug for rheumatoid arthritis and works by inhibiting dihydrofolate reductase. Leflunomide also works for rheumatoid arthritis but by inhibiting pyrimidine synthesis. Hydroxyurea is used for cancer treatment and sickle cell disease. Allopurinol is used for gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and laboratory results suggest rheumatoid arthritis, and Methotrexate is the first-line drug for this condition. It inhibits dihydrofolate reductase, which is necessary for the synthesis of purines and pyrimidines that are needed for DNA synthesis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, laboratory results, and X-ray findings are consistent with rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is the first-line medication used to treat rheumatoid arthritis and it inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. The other options are not used as first-line treatments for rheumatoid arthritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and positive rheumatoid factor and anti-CCP antibodies suggest a diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis. The first-line medication for this condition is methotrexate, which inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. Leflunomide also can be used, but it inhibits pyrimidine synthesis. Hydroxyurea is used in sickle cell disease, and allopurinol is used in gout.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and positive laboratory results suggest rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is a first-line drug for rheumatoid arthritis that inhibits dihydrofolate reductase. Leflunomide inhibits pyrimidine synthesis, Hydroxyurea inhibits DNA synthesis, and Allopurinol is used to treat gout.
